alert.note: Alert for Amite (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued November 29 at 8:48PM CST until November 30 at 2:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CST FOR NORTHEASTERN AMITE COUNTY... At 848 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Smithdale, or 10 miles northwest of Mccomb, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Amite County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
